minimum value at the intersection of the lift/drag curve with the origin.
minimum value at the peak of the lift/drag curve.
maximum value at the intersection of the lift/drag curve with the vertical axis.

variant.question: The position of the transition point on an aerofoil is dependent on:
Compared with level flight prior to the stall, the lift (1) and drag (2) in the stall change as follows:
Where, on a convential low speed aerofoil, will flow separation normally start as angle of attack is increased?

options.text: Upper surface near the trailing edge.
Upper surface near the leading edge.
Lower surface near the trailing edge.
Lower surface near the leading edge.

variant.question: Compared with level flight prior to the stall, the lift ___ and drag ___ in the stall change.
The aft movement of the centre of pressure during the acceleration through the transonic flight regime will:
If the sum of moments in flight is not zero, the aeroplane will rotate about the:

options.text: centre of pressure of the wing.

variant.question: Consider a symmetrical wing with a control surface in the trailing edge. When the control surface is deflected downwards, it (1) _____ the camber, producing a force in the (2) _____ direction of the deflection.

Refer to figure 081-31.
In the attached diagram, select the letter which correctly represents the Angle of Advance (Helix Angle):

Refer to figure 081-31.
In the attached diagram, select the letter which correctly represents the Angle of Attack:
In a glide lift will be:

options.text: Increased by the square root of the load factor
